result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R Harris

defendant.name: Harris, Joseph R
defendant.address: 4509 Pine Ridge Dr 1, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph R Harris in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David Knaapen appears on behalf of Cass W Cousins for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM73 and 16CM85.

10:51 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM73:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM85:
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CM85 and Count 1 of 16CM73 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM73:
Count 1 - DRI

16CM85:
Count 2 -
5 day jail sentence 
4 day jail credit 
Time served sentence for good behavior
Pay $300 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Go to Clerk of Court's Office today to set up payment plan
Provide DNA sample
Plea hearing on December 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Comply with all other bonds he is currently under.

Defendant Joseph R Harris in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Trying to get the attorney appointed to represent him on another matter. 

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
